name: Disney's Coronado Springs Resort

reviews.text: My two kids (7 and 10 year old), hubby and myself enjoyed this Resort from May 1 to 6th. We spent one night at Polynesian before hand (beautiful) and spent rest of stay at this lesser priced resort.
reviews.title: Great mid-priced value in Disney

reviews.text: We stayed at the Cabana Bldg 8A. It is closest to the pool and we had view of lagoon. paying extra for water view is not necessary as you do not have private balcony, only a walkway past all rooms. The building was perfect spot however. No one can actually see the pool as it is surrounded by vegitation. It is not that far to the main buildings for breakfast etc. and is actually quite a bequtiful walk. There are hammocks on the beach (you cannot swim in the water) and yes we diid use the hammocks twice. The rooms were all about the same just different colour schemes. be prepared as they are quite small. However, they are clean. the double beds were an issue for the first 2 nights for the boys, but they got past it.
reviews.title: nice place

reviews.text: We were quite spoilt at the Polynesian, as the rooms were quite big -queen beds and we were in the building that over-looked the pool. Should have booked it last day.
reviews.title: Very Nice Disney Resort for the Money
Coronado Springs was great!
reviews.text: The restaurant Maya Grill was wonderful for breakfast. We did it twice. They have a nice buffet and great service. The Pepper Makket was hit and miss. We tried it twice. The guy at the Mexican area was so friendly, the woman was not. The chicken fajitas had no taste. The pizza guy threw a pizza in the garbage when one fellow asked to change his order. The pizza guy threw a temper tantrum in front of the kids. They thought it was pretty funny actually. The Mexican people working at this hotel only want to help and please, and are so friendly. The American staff are very rude (pizza guy and front desk and concierge). Don't let that put you off however, as this we noticed was the theme the entire trip at Disney.

The pool was very nice. Cool, but very nice. The water slide was well used and we would come back from the parks mid-day to "relax" (sort-of) and grab a drink by the pool and dip in to cool off. The kids used the slide every night. It closes at 8pm every night though. ....hmmm. maybe 7 can't remember now.
reviews.title: Take your walking shoes and $$$
Favorite Disney Hotel!
reviews.text: I am 24 years who has been to Disney about 15 times. I've stayed at verious Disney hotels including the Carribean Beach Resort and Port Orleans Resort and this one by far, is our family favorite! My parents and my little brother are on their way to go this August and I'm so sad not to be going with them :o(... I got married last summer and planned a different vacation formy hubby & I but next year, we'll be going on huge family vacation to this resort. The food is fabulous and the environment is so happy and wonderful! The arcade is a HUGE plus for kids and even by the check-in counter where there's a movie playing with crayons and paper for kids to color which is great! The pool is so large and beautifully landscaped! It can be a little difficult to get too with the large lake in the middle of the resort if you're on the other side of the pool area however, the feet paddle boats are fun! There are always enough chairs at the pool, even in the midddle of the summer!! Cell phone reception is not too good but who cares!?!??! You're at DISNEY!!!! Needless to say, I can't wait to return! Hope this helps!! :o)

reviews.title: Coronado Springs is BEAUTIFUL!
reviews.text: Upon arriving at the hotel, via Magical Express, we found the hotel to be very lush and tropical. Check-in was very fast and the hotel staff was very helpful. Our luggage was delivered to our rooms within minutes of our arrival at the rooms. This is a wonderful service. The rooms were very nice. The refrigerator was a wonderful bonus. Having the sink area seperate from the toilet/shower area was very convenient.

reviews.title: not the best
reviews.text: The food at The Pepper Market was excellent and the portions very large. We were not bothered by the prices since we were participating in the meal plan. However, I did not think that the food prices are any different at Disney than the prices at any resort or vacation area. TIP: Do the meal plan- it is fabulous.

reviews.title: so so at Coronado
reviews.text: It is true that the resort is spread out, however when making reservations simply ask to be in a room near the bus stops, restaurants, or pool area--whatever is of importance to you and your travelling companions. The hotel is very accomodating about this. And the walk is enjoyable with all of the lush, beautiful tropical plants and the lake.

reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service
reviews.text: I will stay at this resort again!

I liked Coronado Springs but after a day of walking all day at the parks, it was a little exasperating to have to walk everywhere at this resort. There is a big lake that is the center of the resort and you have to walk to the pool on the other side, walk to the restaurants, on the others side.... etc. Do not stay here if you can't handle alot of walking.
reviews.title: Be prepared to WALK alot at this resort.....

reviews.text: On another note, there are only TWO restaurants in this hotel and you will pay out the nose for food! For such a large resort you would expect more.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!
What a wonderful Disney Moderate Resort!!!
reviews.text: McDonald's is close by, but that's it! My kids actually were begging us not to take them to McDonald's AGAIN!

reviews.title: Nice Resort
reviews.text: Check-in took about 5 minutes - allocated 8a, fantastic room just 50 steps from Dig Site. Used the quiet pool by 8b and there was only about 5 people there! Pepper Market was slightly confusing - only used the "to go". If you are trying to sit down to have a family meal forget it - someones food was always ready before the rest! Quality of food was excellent. Bus service was excellent. Went to see Fantasmic one night and there was only 7 people on the bus back!!
We were there whilst the "tow show" was on - it made a lovely change to talk to people by the pool who weren't just interested in the parks and rides.
reviews.title: Very Disappointing For Kids
Not a Good Experience
reviews.text: I was at the Coronado Springs Resort for a business convention and family vacation. Before arriving, I did not know that the lobby and convention center are in a separate building and all the rooms are spread out around the lake. Fortunately, there was an employee outside when we drove up who told us not to take our luggage into the lobby. However, we weren't told that we should check it in and have it delivered to our room -- so we ended up having to hike our luggage a good long block or so, because the parking areas at the buildings containing the rooms are not really close to the buildings. Our visit started on the wrong foot when our non-smoking room smelled like an ashtray. After offering to spray the room, they did move us to another which had no odor problems. Unfortunately, we had to wait outside the room, in June heat, for over half an hour before the bellman came with the key to the new room. While we could have waited in the old room, we and our luggage would have soaked up the smell.

reviews.title: Coronado is great!
reviews.text: Our room was over 1/2 mile from the convention center, in what would have been a nice walk around the lake if the temperature had been moderate and if I didn't have a foot condition that makes walking painful. The resort does have little 7-passenger trams that circle the lake. I was told they went around about every 10 minutes, but ended up waiting 25 minutes for one, which made me late for my seminar. After that, I drove over to the convention center.

reviews.title: First time at CSR...Nice Place!
reviews.text: I couldn't get express checkout because the resort staff entered the expiration date of my credit card wrong. I spent 1/2 hour (on my feet at the phones) finding that out. I asked them to mail my receipt to me because I didn't want to stand in line (again) to get it, but they said they couldn't -- I'd have to phone after I got back home and the Research & Billing department could fax me a copy. So that's what I did -- and they'd overcharged me! Another phone call cleared that up, and they did reimburse my employer $0,50 for the phone call when I requested it.
So .... good things: very nice pool, jacuzzi and play area at The Digs. Very nice landscaping.
reviews.title: Third Stay

reviews.text: Not so good: Mediocre rooms, with no easy chair for relaxing. One of the lights in our room was out for the whole of our stay. Sheets are not fitted, and beds are made with blankets tucked in, so when they're pulled out, the bottom sheet is just lying loose on the bed. Very dull colors in the decor, in general. Murals in the lobby looked depressing to me. Badly run tram system, particularly for people who have a schedule to keep. Food at the Pepper Court was not good (although servings were large) but was expensive. Would have been nice if they'd served 1/2 as much, twice as good -- and that would have made the prices more palatable. Food at the convention banquet had problems, too -- mediocre quality. Staff attitude was not especially helpful or friendly, especially compared with how I remembered it from 15 years ago, and in comparison with that of a Savannah hotel at which I'd just stayed.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort!

description: Disney's Coronado Springs Resort is a Southwest-themed Disney Moderate Resort hotel encircling Lago Dorado—a glimmering 22-acre lake—that evokes the spirit and romance of Spanish-colonial Mexico. Follow in the footsteps of explorer Don Francisco de Coronado as he searched for the legendary Seven Cities of Gold while you discover the beauty and fantasy of a unique Resort.
